bill_title: provide that required siting permits be filed with condemnation petitions.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to provide that required siting permits be filed with condemnation petitions. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 21-35-1 be AMENDED: 21-35-1. In all cases whereIf any person, group, or corporation, public or private, including the owners of water rights, ditches, flumes, reservoirs, and mining property under the provisions of the laws of Congress, invested with the privilege of taking or damaging private property for public use, in making, constructing, repairing, or using any work or improvement allowed by law, shall determine determines to exercise such that privilege, it shall the person must first file a petition in the circuit court for the county in which the property to be taken or damaged is situated, praying that the just compensation to be made for such the property may be ascertained by a jury. If the person invested with the privilege of taking or damaging private property for public use is required, pursuant to chapter 49-41B, to obtain, from the Public Utilities Commission, a permit for the construction and operation of a facility, the petition required by this section must include a copy of that permit.
